SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.cliendhandlers

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.cliendhandlers.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
Direct Known Subclasses:
RMIClientHandler, SocketClientHandler
public abstract class ClientHandler extends Object implements Observer
Generic client handler object. A ClientHandler is a kind of Observer that sends the updates generated by the observed object to the client. It also checks that the client is still online by monitoring ingoing traffic and by sending ping messages if the client.

    • getPlayerIdentifier

      public String getPlayerIdentifier()
      Retrieves the player's identifier
      Returns:
      playerIdentifier that identifies the player handled by this object

    • setPlayerIdentifier

      Parameters:
      playerIdentifier - playerIdentifier that identifies the player handled by this object

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(ServerMessage message)
      Triggered when an observed object notify its subscribers. If the update shouldn't be delivered to the client handled by this ClientHandler, the message will be ignored.
      Specified by:
      onUpdate in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      message - the message that needs to be delivered to the client.

    • sendMessage

      public abstract void sendMessage(ServerMessage message)
      Allows to send a message to the client handled by this object
      Parameters:
      message - ServerMessage object containing the data that needs to be sent to the client

    • setController

      public final void setController(GameControllerWrapper gameControllerWrapper)
      Allows to provide the controller to the game the player's playing to the ClientHandler.
      Parameters:
      gameControllerWrapper - GameControllerWrapper that wraps the GameController of the game the client's playing

      public final void resetController()
      Sets the ClientHandler controller as null

    • getTimeSinceDisconnection

      public final long getTimeSinceDisconnection()
      Returns the time elapsed since the disconnection occurred, in millisecond. If the client is currently online (not disconnected), it returns 0
      Returns:
      time elapsed since disconnection in millisecond, 0 if client's online

    • isDisconnected

      public boolean isDisconnected()
      Checks whether the client's disconnected or not.
      Returns:
      true if the client's disconnected, false otherwise

    • messageReceived

      public final void messageReceived()
      Allows to inform the ClientHandler that a message from the client was received
